channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-14135] beeline output not formatted correctly for large column widths
item.description:
If the column width is too large then beeline uses the maximum column width when normalizing all the column widths. In order to reproduce the issue, run set -v;

Once the configuration variables is classpath which can be extremely large width (41k characters in my environment).
item.summary: beeline output not formatted correctly for large column widths

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12815263 - PreCommit-HIVE-MASTER-Build
Sergio Peña can you please review the patch?
Vihang Karajgaonkar Can you please give some examples of the output before and after this change ?

Thanks Vihang Karajgaonkar for the examples.
This change would make BufferedRows give practically the same output as IncrementalRows if columns are larger than the maxwidth of 15 chars.
Can we also increase the default maxWidth as part of this change, so that in most cases the formatting is still good. Maybe something like 50 chars ?

Can you also please include an unit test case ?
Thanks Thejas M Nair for your suggestions. I will add them to the patch and submit it again.
Updated the patch with a testcase to handle columns with large widths. Changes the default column width from 15 to 50 characters.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12817238 - PreCommit-HIVE-MASTER-Build

The patch looks good. Just a couple of questions:

TestBufferedRows

  • Is the setUp() method needed? Can we remove it?

BeeLineOpts

  • What's the difference between DEFAULT_MAX_COLUMN_WIDTH and DEFAULT_MAX_WIDTH? Why do they have 80 vs 50?
  • Is there a way to specify the max width from a command line parameter?

Thanks Sergio Peña for taking a look. Can you take a look at the latest review (version 2 in the review board)? The setup() method is removed.

I think DEFAULT_MAX_WIDTH is the max line (row) width and DEFAULT_MAX_COLUMN_WIDTH is the max width for column. According to documentation https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/Hive/HiveServer2+Clients

--maxWidth=MAXWIDTH The maximum column width, in characters, when outputformat is table. Default is 15.
Usage: beeline --maxColumnWidth=25

--maxColumnWidth=MAXCOLWIDTH The maximum column width, in characters, when outputformat is table. Default is 15.
Usage: beeline --maxColumnWidth=25

(oops, I replied to the email thread instead of here, so I'll duplicate my comment for the record)

That looks like a cut-&-paste error. Here's what the wiki says for --maxWidth:

--maxWidth=MAXWIDTH The maximum width to display before truncating data, in characters, when outputformat is table. Default is to query the terminal for current width, then fall back to 80.

Thanks.

Could you update the Wiki so that it displays the new default value on --maxColumnWith? One thing first, why did we change from 15 to 50?
Another request, could you attach the output results with different output formats --outputformat=[table/vertical/csv/tsv/dsv/csv2/tsv2]?
Thanks Lefty Leverenz for correcting

Attaching the results with different output formats as requested. I changed 15 to 50 to address one of the changes suggested by Thejas M Nair since we feel that 15 is probably too small for most common results. I don't have permissions to update the wiki. I will check if Lefty Leverenz can help me with that. Thanks for the review!

Thanks Vihang Karajgaonkar. The patch looks good
+1
Added updated patch which has Mohit's suggestions

Vihang Karajgaonkar, to update the wiki just get a Confluence account and tell me your username, as described here:

About This Wiki – How to get permission to edit
